CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of an apartment in GPE , which she had let to LOC
CARDINAL . In a registered letter of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant informed the tenant that she intended to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on DATE and asked him to vacate the LOC by DATE .
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE the applicant reiterated her intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before the Florence Magistrate .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the Florence Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises be vacated by CARDINAL DATE . That decision was made enforceable on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenant requiring him to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE , she served notice on the tenant informing him that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession .

CARDINAL . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as , under the statutory provisions providing for the suspension or the staggering of evictions , the applicant was not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant made a statutory declaration that she urgently required the premises in order to sell them at a normal market price .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession .
CARDINAL . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was never granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . Following the entry into force of Law No . CARDINAL , the enforcement proceedings were suspended until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the Florence Magistrate ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
